subject: Re: [junit] Which parameter in my list failed?
msgSnippet: TestNG restricts this output to a certain size, since the point is not necessarily to have the entire output but just to identify which parameters are causing
messageBody:
TestNG restricts this output to a certain size, since the point is not
necessarily to have the entire output but just to identify which parameters
are causing the test to fail.

--
Cedric


On 1/29/07, Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Cedric,
>
> On 1/30/07, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@... <cbeust%40google.com>>
> wrote:
> > Why not output the .toString() of the parameters?
> > (...)
> > PASSED: testA("Cedric", 20)
> > PASSED: testA("David", 21)
> > (...)
> > This makes it trivial to diagnose a failed data-driven test.
>
> I'm not sure if that's a good idea in all cases, considering the
> "domain" we're talking about--the parameterized data could be the
> contents of massive XML files and so forth. Having a way to disable
> the toString output would be nice in those cases.
>




T

Lasse
>
>



--
Cédric
